alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Ritchie; Roane; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, southeastern Ritchie, Doddridge, Nicholas, Gilmer, western Lewis, Braxton, southeastern Roane, western Webster, Clay, northern Fayette and western Harrison Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Harrisville to 7 miles west of Summersville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weston, Summersville, Richwood, Harrisville, Glenville, Sutton, Grantsville, Clay, Salem, Ansted, Gassaway, West Union, Gauley Bridge, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Hawks Nest State Park, Craigsville and Big Otter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 30 and 94. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 47 and 69. Route 19 between mile markers 21 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Ritchie; Roane; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
